content: herrade slipover tricodo by dominique krucker the herrade slipover is worked top down the back side of the yoke is worked first then the shoulders the fronts around neckline and armholes to be finally all joined to be worked in the round it is knitted in stockinette stitch with a nice ribbing edge that goes down only at the right side and will grow all around the body in a gently sloping 4 sizes are available s-m-l-xl the sample is shown in size m the herrade slipover is inspired by a vest i saw in felletin last oktober from « laines paysannes » and i have their agreement to publish this as free to ravelry measurements see below page 8 finished bust circumferences unstretched 90-98-106-112 cm /35½-38½-41¾-44 inches the slipover may lose its strength easily with its rib parts its length is easily adaptable too explained in due time armholes have a wide opening gauge 19 sts x 27 row = 10 x 10 cm /4 x 4 inches in stockinette stitch with 4 5 mm us 7 needles 1 tricodo © copyright 2025 needles circular needles 4 5 mm us 7 and 3 5 mm us 4 for the neckline hem yarn terrade worsted 4 ply skeins of 100g 3 skeins for all sizes or gilliat from de rerum natura balls of 100g/250m 273 yds 625m to 670m & 250g to 280g 683 to 732 yds = 3 balls for all sizes materials 2 markers one for bor 2 removable markers 1 tapestry needle rib bands will be worked all around armholes and go on all along the right side of the slip over while the other side will be stopped after the underarm rib band edgdes 12 sts each at right of the work rs k2 p1 4 times ws k1 p2 3 times k1 sl2pwyif at left side of the work rs p1 k2 4 times ws sl2pwyif k1 p2 3 times k1 let s go back with needle 4 5mm us 7 co 64-64-68-68 sts & work in back and forth as follows ws sl2pwyif k1 p2 3 times k1 p to last 12 sts k1 p2 3 times k1 sl2pwyif rs k2 p1 4 times k to last 12 sts p1 k2 4 times repeat these last 2 row to have 15-15-14-13 cm measure at the middle work a ws row once more now work increases at right & left of the rs row as follows rs k2 p1 4 times k1 m1l k to last 13 sts m1r k1 p1 k2 4 times ws sl2pwyif work as sts present to last 2 sts sl2pwyif work these last 2 row a total of 10-11-12-13 times 10-11-12-13 increase x 2 => 64-64-68-68 + 10- 11-12-13 x 2 = 84-86-92-94 sts in tot break the yarn and put all sts on hold to waste yarn while the shoulders and front are worked left shoulder pick up
